GradientColor

The GradientColor object.

Constructors

GradientColor(gradient, origin, destination[, hilite])
GradientColor(gradient, origin, destination[, hilite])

Creates a gradient color object.

    Parameters:
  • gradient: Gradient
  • origin: Point
  • destination: Point
  • hilite: Point — optional

Example — Applying a linear gradient color containing evenly distributed color stops:

Run

Example — Applying a radial gradient color containing unevenly distributed color stops:

Run

Properties

origin
origin

The origin point of the gradient.

    Type:
  • Point

Example — Move the origin point of the gradient, by moving your mouse over the view below:

Run
destination
destination

The destination point of the gradient.

    Type:
  • Point

Example — Move the destination point of the gradient, by moving your mouse over the view below:

Run
hilite
hilite

The hilite point of the gradient.

    Type:
  • Point

Example — Move the hilite point of the gradient, by moving your mouse over the view below:

Run

Methods

clone()
clone()
    Returns:
  • GradientColor — a copy of the gradient color
equals(color)
equals(color)

Checks if the gradient color has the same properties as that of the supplied one.

    Parameters:
  • color: GradientColor
    Returns:
  •  — true the GradientColor is the same, false otherwise
transform(matrix)
transform(matrix)

Transform the gradient color by the specified matrix.

    Parameters:
  • matrix: Matrix — the matrix to transform the gradient color by
